content.raw: From what I gather, the `SpawnDropCoGOffset` failure is due to use of mesh collision geometry, but why is `DropStuff` failing? Is DART not simulating inelastic collision here?
content.html: From what I gather, the SpawnDropCoGOffset failure is due to use of mesh collision geometry, but why is DropStuff failing? Is DART not simulating inelastic collision here?

content.raw:
This has nothing to do with the use of mesh collision geometry. 

DART reduces position constraint error (e.g., unexpected penetration between bodies) indirectly by generating error correction velocity, which is different with ODE. ODE directly changes the pose of the body to correct the position constraint violation without any additional velocity.

The error correction velocity of DART sometimes too large when the penetration is large. To handle this unwanted bouncing, DART has two parameters, which are error reduction parameter (ERP) (similar to ODE's)  and maximum error reduction velocity (ERV).

The current default ERV is 10 m/s. I think this is too large. I'll decrease the default ERP by 0.001 m/s then DART can pass test.
content.html:
This has nothing to do with the use of mesh collision geometry.

DART reduces position constraint error (e.g., unexpected penetration between bodies) indirectly by generating error correction velocity, which is different with ODE. ODE directly changes the pose of the body to correct the position constraint violation without any additional velocity.

The error correction velocity of DART sometimes too large when the penetration is large. To handle this unwanted bouncing, DART has two parameters, which are error reduction parameter (ERP) (similar to ODE's) and maximum error reduction velocity (ERV).

The current default ERV is 10 m/s. I think this is too large. I'll decrease the default ERP by 0.001 m/s then DART can pass test.

content.raw:
This method injects artificial energy into the system which may result in unstable dynamics. [An issue](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/issues/201) is created about this in DART.

Should we mark this as not passing DropStuff test?
content.html:
This method injects artificial energy into the system which may result in unstable dynamics. An issue is created about this in DART.

Should we mark this as not passing DropStuff test?

content.raw: The DropStuff is passing as of 2d660de with the latest dart release-4.0 commits.
content.html: The DropStuff is passing as of 2d660de with the latest dart release-4.0 commits.
